abstract: Dilma Rousseff, suspended president of Brazil, takes stand at impeachment trial in country's Senate where she maintains she is innocent of charges brought up against her; if Senate garners sufficient votes to convict her, interim president Michel Temer will in office until end of Rousseff's current term in 2018.

headline.print_headline: In Her Impeachment Trial in Brazil, Rousseff Says She Won’t Be Silenced
headline.main: Dilma Rousseff of Brazil Says She Won’t Be Silenced in Impeachment Trial

snippet: The suspended president took the stand and fiercely argued that she was innocent of the charges of manipulating the federal budget....
lead_paragraph: The suspended president took the stand and fiercely argued that she was innocent of the charges of manipulating the federal budget.
